definition: to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick

sentences.english: The Texas system challenged by Ms. Fisher is idiosyncratic.
sentences.chinese: 受到费舍女士挑战的德克萨斯录取系统非常特别。

sentences.english: There is no denying, that as a challenger now, we have a fight on our hands.
sentences.chinese: 不可否认，我们作为挑战者，将有一场硬仗要打。

sentences.english: Anna's constant search for new ideas and challenges keeps her ahead of her times.
sentences.chinese: 对新理念与挑战的不断追求令安娜始终走在时代前列。

sentences.english: The road ahead for Libya and its people will be difficult and full of challenges.
sentences.chinese: 利比亚面前的路将充满坎坷和挑战。

sentences.english: First Zheng Jiejiu has used up two challenge eagle-eyed opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 第一盘郑洁就用掉了两次挑战鹰眼的机会。

sentences.english: and an aging Challenger-class diesel submarine, the Conqueror.
sentences.chinese: 和老化的挑战者级柴油潜艇“征服者”。

sentences.english: So that was a more recent one.
sentences.chinese: 上面所说的是近年来遇到的挑战。

sentences.english: She admits that her life is not a fairy tale and that she faces many challenges.
sentences.chinese: 她坦承她的生活并非童话般轻松，而要面对很多挑战。

sentences.english: Ming court belied that its greatest challenges and opportunities were at home.
sentences.chinese: 明朝朝廷认识到最大的挑战和机遇是在国内。

sentences.english: The challenger showed the white feather as soon as he stepped into the ring with the champion.
sentences.chinese: 这位挑战者同冠军一踏进拳击场时就胆怯了。

sentences.english: It's little surprise then that there's not much incentive for retailers and e-tailers to challenge the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 零售商和网售商挑战出新的动机不大，一点也不奇怪。

sentences.english: Honest, positive, detailed and courage to meet challenge.
sentences.chinese: 诚笃，踊跃，仔细，敢于接管挑战。

sentences.english: You can break through and challenge your crystallized patterns and mind-sets.
sentences.chinese: 你可以突破和挑战你的固化模式和心态。

sentences.english: Conquering its challenges has become the quest of Chinese engineers.
sentences.chinese: 征服所有挑战已经成了中国工程师们孜孜的追求。

sentences.english: However, Ibrahimovic says he lacks the desire to start afresh.
sentences.chinese: 但是，伊布表示他缺乏接受新挑战的欲望。

sentences.english: Food prices pose a serious challenge to society at large.
sentences.chinese: 全社会面临这食品价格的严峻挑战。

definition: to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
to face sth/to be confronted with
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
(of a commanding officer) to keep watch/to oversee
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
